alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cameron; Coastal Kenedy; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Kenedy Island (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 20 at 9:18PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...AREAS OF FOG DEVELOPING AND EXPECTED TO BECOME DENSE... Satellite imagery and surface observations indicate that fog is rolling westward in from the coast with visibilities lowering at the Cameron County and Brownsville/SPI airports. Rich Gulf moisture continues to pool along Lower Texas coastal areas in the vicinity of a developing coastal trough/low. Fog is likely to persist through the night and into Saturday morning with visibility lowering to one half mile at times. Although probabilities of dense fog with visibility dropping below one- quarter mile remain low at this time, it is not out of the question that dense fog may develop for a few hours overnight. The National weather service will continue to monitor for dense fog development. Motorists are urged to reduce speed, use low beam headlights, and avoid tailgating in any fog overnight especially along highways 100 and 48 heading east towards Laguna Vista and South Padre Island. A Dense Fog Advisory may need to be issued later tonight if the fog becomes more widespread and thicker.
